cause.description: We respectfully request that the Civil Rights Division of the United States Department of Justice review events surrounding the prosecution of six Black students in Jena, Louisiana, to determine whether the civil rights of Jena residents have been violated. http://www.petitiononline.com/aZ51CqmR/petition.html Please follow the link and sign the petition. Also see: All About Race Elle, PhD ETA: Friends of Justice Automatic Preference for updates. Also, please consider donating to the Friends of Justice. More links: While Seated Countercurrents Color of Change 1. The Jena Six are being unfairly prosecuted. 2. The recent conviction of Mychal Bell is wrong. His lawyer declined to call a single defense witness because a "white jury would question the veracity of a black high school student."
cause.mission: To spread awareness about and inspire action against the unfair prosecution of six Black students in Jena, LA.
cause.name: Justice for the Jena Six
